Save for dermatologists, there are seldom folks who are as knowledgeable about the inner workings of our epidermis as aestheticians. Like doctors, they've seen it all: acne, hyperpigmentation, scarring, and rosacea. The main difference is you're probably not going to book a facial if you're having an eczema flare-up. While facialists certainly see their fair share of skin concerns, it's their job not to prescribe drugs, but rather to provide treatments that help soothe and transform the skin over time. What's more: Said treatments are usually super tranquil and administered on a sleep-inducing spa table.

Aside from the relaxation factor, another tempting reason to see a facialist (interchangeably called aesthetician), is the personalized approach. Most of the time these complexion caregivers work by meticulously examining your skin and treating it with whatever it needs, whether it's a heavy dose of hydration, uncomfortable extractions, or a dose of LED light therapy. Celebrities, bloggers, and beauty editors (not to mention everyday folks who crave a clear complexion) rely on aestheticians for balanced, soothed skin that glows — without the highlighter.

But, I wonder: How do these skin whisperers care for their own complexions? Because I couldn't shake the curiosity, I decided to ask. Ahead, find the skin-care routines and secrets of seven top facialists.

Courtesy of Sofie Pavitt/brands

Morning:

Before heading to her cozy skin-care studio on the Lower East Side, facialist Sofie Pavitt wakes up her skin with a splash of toner — and that's that. "My skin is quite dry so I don't wash my face in the morning — instead, I go straight to toning. I'm a big fan of the Circumference Active Botanical Refining Toner, which is hydrating," she says.

Straight after toner, she slathers on a vitamin C serum — and just like so many skin-care devotees, SkinCeuticals's C E Ferulic Serum is her chosen one. "It's an OG classic because it's so effective without being irritating," says Pavitt. Post-serum, she layers on Soleil Toujours' Organic Daily Sunless Tanning Serum to warm up her winter complexion. "Like everyone, my skin can look a little dull in the winter and this helps brighten it up," she says. "I add a couple of drops to my face a few days a week which gives me a nice glow."
title: 7 Top Aestheticians Reveal Their Skin-Care Routines
